topic.title: Enabling High Availability and Data Consistency Features

abstract.shortdesc: The fault tolerance and the high-availability features of Greenplum Database can be configured.

body.note:
When data loss is not acceptable for a Greenplum Database cluster, Greenplum master and segment mirroring is recommended. If mirroring is not enabled then Greenplum stores only one copy of the data, so the underlying storage media provides the only guarantee for data availability and correctness in the event of a hardware failure.
With Greenplum for Kubernetes the downtime incurred for replacing a failed segment is significantly minimized, and mirrorless deployments are recommended to ensure maximum availability for the Greenplum cluster. VMware supports production, mirrorless deployments of Greenplum for Kubernetes for this reason. Other deployment environments are generally not supported for production use unless both Greenplum master and segment mirroring are enabled.
body.p: For information about the utilities that are used to enable high availability, see the Greenplum Database Utility Guide.
